alert.note: Alert for Henry; Rock Island; Whiteside (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 09 at 3:38AM CDT until August 12 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Illinois... Rock River near Joslin affecting Whiteside, Henry IL and Rock Island Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois... Rock River at Moline affecting Henry IL and Rock Island Counties. Pecatonica River at Freeport affecting Stephenson County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rock River near Joslin. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Water affects residences in outlying areas immediately along the river including basements, yards, driveways, and access roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 9.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this afternoon to 13.9 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued this afternoon.
